channel.title: Tools & Processes on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme
channel.description: Recent content in Tools & Processes on Documentation for Hugo Learn Theme

item.title: Installing and Configuring aws-vault
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)

Subject: Installing and Configuring aws-vault

Revision History: 2024-01-24 - Version 1 created by Luke Heidelberger

Details: In order to facilitate more secure use of aws-cli with IAM users, CTAC utilizes the aws-vault package. aws-vault Stores your AWS IAM credentials in a secure, encrypted way and generates temporary credentials for AWS CLI commands.

item.title: CTAC monthly patching
item.description:
Subject: CTAC monthly Patching Revision History: 2021-11-22 - Version 1 created by Bao, Ali and Andrew 2022-06-02 - added patching for other projects 2022-06-02 - monthly patching 2022-06-16 - removed solr, tika, stage patching section

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

CTAC Monthly Patching KB

URLS (requires CTAC VPN):

  • https://cpsc-d8-stg.ctacdev.com/
  • https://cpsc-d8-prod.ctacdev.com/
  • scan.ctacdev.com
  • log.ctacdev.com
  • ci.ctacdev.com
  • Note: need dab, arim, etc urls.

Notify @channel in #cpsc about stage. and tell them when you plan on doing prod.

Manual patching (for prod only):

  • Ensure that CPSC inventory is updated to match current/existing static hosts in resources/common/files/patching/cpsc-hosts.yml.

item.title: default ticket close spiel
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Default ticket spiel

Revision History:
    2015-09-24 09:57:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

If an acceptable time has passed and no response from the individual that has opened the ticket, go ahead and close with this spiel. Please note that the spiel is addressed to Robert. If the person that opened the ticket is in fact robert, then copy paste this in its entirety. If not, hopefully you know what to do.


Hi Robert,
I haven't heard back from you regarding this ticket so I'm going to assume all is well on your end. But in the event that there is anything still outstanding, please feel free to reopen this ticket. 
Thanks, and have a great day.
 
--
No response. Closing.


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: Leave request
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Leave Request, out of office, doctor's appointments

Revision History:
    2019-10-4 23:54:12 - Version 1 created by Bao


Details:

=================================================
Original email (croyal 27-Dec 2018)
=================================================
Just a reminder to all that when you are requesting time off there are two steps:
 
1) send an e-mail to your supervisor and HR with the request—in some cases, it is also appropriate to include your team members to insure client coverage
 
2) request the leave in the timesheet system for actual approval from your supervisor
 
Also, if you are going to be out of the office for more than an hour or two (appointments, late arrival, early departure, etc.), this should also be communicated via e-mail to your supervisor and HR.
 
Please let HR know if you have any questions
 
 
Thanks!


=================================================
Reminder email (mkhalkho 14-Aug 2019)
=================================================
All,

In light of recent events, a friendly reminder of leave request procedures:

1- Submit your leave request in Deltek.
2- Send an email to HR and your PMs to let them know of your leave request submission.

Doing so allows for accurate and timely reporting, billing and coordination of tasks.

Thank you!

Magali



************************************************************************
System-admin specific addendums
************************************************************************
The following currently applies to those supporting the HHS O&M portion of the HHS project
- Leave request is exactly that: a request. It should not be assumed that the leave request is automatically approved. First submit your request and ensure that is approved before proceeding with making plans.
- Leave request needs to be submitted at least 7 business days in advance. This is to allow for proper reporting of hours to the client. 
- In addition to the email recipients mentioned above, leave requests should be clearly communicated with - at a minimum, your team lead, your PM(s), your manager. This email should be sent at least 7 business days in advance.
- If you are on call for the week that you are requesting leave, it is your responsibility to coordinate coverage.
- If you will be returning to work during the week that you are on call & after the date of hand off, it is your responsibility to coordinate coverage.
- A reminder email should be sent at least 24 hours prior to the start of your PTO.
- notifications for doctor's appointments should be 


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: ssl labs downgradedratings
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)
=================================================

Subject: SSL Labs downgraded ratings


Revision History:
    2016-03-01 13:52:00 - Version 1 created by Bao


Relevant URLs:
	- https://ssllabs.com


If you stand up a new site and enable https, be sure to add the following in the https section:

SSLProtocol all -SSLv2 -SSLv3
SSLHonorCipherOrder on
SSLCipherSuite "EECDH+ECDSA+AESGCM EECDH+aRSA+AESGCM EECDH+ECDSA+SHA384 EECDH+ECDSA+SHA256 EECDH+aRSA+SHA384 EECDH+aRSA+SHA256 EECDH+aRSA+RC4 EECDH EDH+aRSA RC4 !aNULL !eNULL !LOW !3DES !MD5 !EXP !PSK !SRP !DSS !RC4"

as for the ssl cert, there are 3 parts: the crt, key and chain. be sure these are added as follows:

    SSLCertificateFile /etc/apache2/certs/star_hhs/hhs_gov.crt
    SSLCertificateKeyFile /etc/apache2/certs/star_hhs/hhs_gov.key
    SSLCertificateChainFile /etc/apache2/certs/star_hhs/DigiCertCA.crt

Then visit ssllabs.com and run a test on the URL. hopefully you get an A for everything.

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: vim shortcut keys
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Shortcuts to use for Vim on Linux and macOS systems that have Vim installed.

Revision History:
    2019-01-10 10:44:00 - Version 1 created by Ali Muhammad
    2019-07-30 15:14:14 - 1.1 - added some more commands (bao)

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)


Open a file in VIM: vim test.txt


UNDERSTANING VIM MODES:

Command Mode: Files open in command mode by default. Files can be edited using certain keys which act as a command. Esc or CTRL+C key returns Vim to Command mode from any other mode.

Insert Mode: i or Insert key switches to Insert mode for editing the text.





Vim commands in Command mode:
Note: Passing number prior to commands will move them the relevant number of times.
h       -->       move cursor one key to left.

k       -->       move cursor one key to up.

j       -->       move cursor one key to down.

l       -->       move cursor one key to right.

x       -->       x key will delete the character on which the scroll currently is upon.

w       -->       move cursor to next word.

e       -->       move cursor to last character of current word.

b       -->       move cursor to first character of current word (if already at first character, then moves to the previous word's first character).

0       -->       move cursor to the beginning of current line.

$       -->       move cursor to the end of current line.

(       -->       moves to the space after previous dot '.'

)       -->       moves to the space after next dot '.'

%       -->       switch between matching pair brackets, functions, greater/lower than signs and other functions.

a       -->       switches to append/insert mode, only difference from insert mode is that it writes before the cursor letter.

A       -->       switches to append/insert mode, only difference from insert mode is that it writes at the end of current line.

r+character       -->       By pressing r and then any character, the item on which the cursor is will be replaced with that character.

u       -->       Undo a whole action.

x       -->       undo one action at a time. (I think this is incorrect: it deletes one char at a time).

.       -->       redoing or pasting a whole action again.

dd        -->       deletes an entire line. This also copies the line into memory and you can paste it to another place in the file


d + cursor        -->       remove the word the cursor is moved to.

dw        -->       deletes a word.

d0        -->       from the cursor point, it will delete everything till the beginning of the line.

d$        -->       from the cursor point, it will delete everything till the end of the line.

3r        -->       Adding any amount of numbers prior to r will replace all the next characters accordingly. For e.g. 3r will replace the next 3 characters with whatever character is supplied.

3dw       -->       Adding any amount of numbers prior to d will delete all the next words accordingly. For e.g. 3dw will delete the next 3 words.

yy        -->       copy the line that the scroll is on.

p       -->       paste anything that was copied.



v + scroll + y        -->       highlights and copies the content highlighted.

>>        -->       Inserts a tab indent.

<<        -->       Removes a tab indent.

/       -->       search for a character or word from top. Use n key to move between the search results from top to bottom in this case. Use N key to move backwards between the search results i.e. from bottom to top in this case.

?       -->       search for a character or word from bottom. Use n key to move between the search results from bottom to top in this case. Use N key to move between the search results by moving to any word/character found under the current scrolling word/character.

ZZ        -->       Save and Exit immediately.




Vim commands in Command EOF (using colon) mode:
:q!       -->       :q! key will exit from vim window without saving any changes.

:wq       -->       :wq key will exit from vim window while saving all changes.

:%s/this/THIS/g       -->       Will globally replace 'this' to 'THIS' word without prompting for confirmation.

:%s/this/THIS/gc        -->       Will globally replace 'this' to 'THIS' word while prompting for confirmation.

:!command       -->       Will perform the command operation. For e.g. if you do :!ls , it will print the contents of the directory in which the file opened up in VIM exists. Benefit is that you don't have to quit out of Vim to execute any command. The important part is to type in :! and then follow by whichever command it is you need executed.

:r ! cat /home/user/file.txt        -->       reads and write the output from file.txt generated by concatenating a file.

:19,26 | sort -r ---> Reversing the lines. Using this command, line 19 will be moved to line 26 and line 26 will move to line 19. Same goes for all the other lines in between.

:saveas newfile.txt       -->       making changes in an existing file on Vim but not saving it into that file, rather saving them into a new file called newfile.txt



:set number -->       shows line numbers

dG        -->       deletes from current line to the end of the file

3x       -->       deletes 3 characters

:0       -->       moves cursor to beginning of the file

o       -->       inserts a line below the cursor

O       -->       inserts a line above the cursor

xyy        -->       copy the x number of lines

ddx        -->       delete the x number of lines (also copies this into memory to allow pasting elsewhere in the file)

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: CPSC Siteshield IPs
item.description:
Step 1: Introduce each person on the call and explain what CTAC does. 

CTAC has been a systems integrator focused primarily on the federal space for over 25 years.  We offer cloud solutions, operations/devops/secops and application development services, just to name a few.

The System Administration/Cloud Engineering team you are applying for consists of, currently, '8' persons.   We architect, implement and maintain a wide variety of products and services.  We are almost exclusively in AWS and are an AWS Partner.

Step 2: Ask candidate to introduce themselves and give overview of experience in Operations, DevOps, SecOps, ServiceOps, Development. Describe their interests/passions and goals.

Step 3: Questions

Instruct Candidate: There are no wrong/right answers. If you do not know the answer that is ok. If you need more clarity on the question, just ask. We use the questions to determine your experience level in various areas/technologies
